titleStmt.title: Granville Clarke et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10736

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned are acquainted with Westin Hoover & Andrew Lees & wife the persons who prosecuted Hoover. Hoover is an honest_ moral & industrious man. He is poore & depends for the support of his family upon his daily labor. He has always sustained a good moral character. But on the contrary Lees & wife are persons of bad reputation & are not generally beleived among their acquaintnaces to be worthy of beleif.

Granville Clarke
Peter Roth
gubnert Pfilizz
Peter Luwon
J A Stewart
Michael Coffey
Cornelious Swerry
Patrick Walsh
John Friedbaud
Henry Hamsath
A W H OKenann
Auton Hemesath
J S Booth
G Fischer
T F Schikner
T G Zimlink
Michel Reeves
Thomas Harrison
Conrad Ackerman
Jonhe Hoffmann
Aloys Geyer
Henry Henn
Chas E. L. Mage
A Gesinger A Kalin
W Sihite
Martin Meyers
Remitted as to imprisonment and respite the fee for 12 Mos

Kenton Cir Ct
$50. & 30 days imprisonment
Rape
Martin Hoover
